original: In hindsight, deciding to go on a hike into the woods this morning wasn't the best idea.
pt: Em retrospectiva, decidir ir em uma caminhada na floresta esta manhã não foi a melhor idéia.
back: In retrospect, deciding to go on a walk in the forest this morning was not the best idea.

original: I felt supernaturally compelled that today was the day I'd tackle that new route.
pt: Senti-me compelido sobrenaturalmente que hoje era o dia em que eu iria enfrentar essa nova rota.
back: I felt compelled supernaturally that today was the day that I would face this new route.

original: Compelled enough that I didn't bother to check the forecast before I left.
pt: Completado o suficiente para não me incomodar em verificar a previsão antes de sair.
back: Complete enough not to bother me to check the forecast before leaving.

original: Slowly, the snow got heavier and heavier.
pt: Devagar, a neve ficou cada vez mais pesada.
back: Slowly, the snow got heavier and heavier.

original: It was a miracle that just as it was getting too hard to bare, I saw the light of what looked like a small cottage in the distance.
pt: Foi um milagre que assim como estava ficando difícil de desenmascarar, eu vi a luz do que parecia uma pequena cabana na distância.
back: It was a miracle that just as it was getting hard to unmask, I saw the light of what looked like a small cabin in the distance.

original: I approach the cottage. The door opens without the handle turning at all.
pt: Aproximo-me da cabana e a porta abre sem que o cabo gire.
back: - I come near the cabin and the door opens without the cable turning.

original: Not having time to think about it, and faced with the increasing winds and heavy snow, I enter, closing the door behind me.
pt: Não tendo tempo para pensar nisso, e diante dos ventos crescentes e da neve pesada, eu entro, fechando a porta atrás de mim.
back: Having no time to think about it, and before the rising winds and heavy snow, I enter, closing the door behind me.

original: The inside seems normal enough.
pt: O interior parece normal o suficiente.
back: The interior seems normal enough.

original: It's nice and warm too, thank goodness.
pt: É agradável e quente também, graças a Deus.
back: It's nice and warm too, thank God.

original: ...Hello? Is anyone home?
pt: Alguém está em casa?
back: - Is anyone home?

original: W-welcome!
pt: Bem-vindos!
back: - Welcome!

original: Uh, hi— sorry for barging in, but the snowstorm outside is getting really bad.
pt: Desculpe por entrar, mas a tempestade de neve lá fora está ficando muito ruim.
back: - Sorry to come in, but the snowstorm out there is getting really bad.

original: Is it ok if I wait here until it's passed?
pt: Está tudo bem se eu esperar aqui até que ela passe?
back: - Is it okay if I wait here until she passes?

original: Absolutely! In fact, I have the couch already made up for you!
pt: Na verdade, eu já tenho o sofá compensado por você!
back: Actually, I already have the couch compensated for you!

original: ...Huh? How did you know I was--
pt: Como você sabia que eu estava...
back: - How did you know I was...

original: U-uh...I mean, I always have the couch ready in case of unexpected guests!
pt: U-uh... Quero dizer, eu sempre tenho o sofá pronto em caso de convidados inesperados!
back: U-uh... I mean, I always have the couch ready in case of unexpected guests!

original: Y'know...because sometimes that might happen.
pt: Você sabe... porque às vezes isso pode acontecer.
back: You know... because sometimes that can happen.

original: So...um....P-please make yourself at home.
pt: Então...um...P-por favor, sinta-se em casa.
back: - So... um... please feel at home.

original: Thanks, I appreciate it.
pt: Obrigado, eu agradeço.
back: - Thank you, I appreciate it.

- I don't know. - No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

- I don't know. - No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

original: U-uh. If you don't mind. What's your name?
pt: Se não se importar, qual é o seu nome?
back: If you don't mind, what's your name?

original: It's Maple.
pt: É Maple.
back: It's Maple.

original: M-maple! That's a pretty name.
pt: É um nome bonito.
back: - It's a beautiful name.

original: Thanks.
pt: Obrigado.
back: - Thank you.

- I don't know. - No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

original: ...And, uh- what's yours?
pt: ...e qual é o seu?
back: -...and what's yours?

original: Oh! R-right. My name's Swirley.
pt: Meu nome é Swirley.
back: - My name is Swirley.

original: SHIRLEY. My name's Shirley.
pt: Meu nome é Shirley.
back: - My name is Shirley.

original: Nice to meet you, Shirley. That's a pretty name too.
pt: Prazer em conhecê-la, Shirley.
back: - Nice to meet you, Shirley.

original: Thank you.
pt: Obrigado.
back: - Thank you.

original: This is a really pretty cottage- do you live here alone?
pt: Isto é uma casa de campo realmente bonita. Você mora aqui sozinha?
back: This is a really nice country house. Do you live here alone?

original: T-thank you! And yes, it's just me here.
pt: E sim, sou só eu aqui.
back: - And yes, it's just me here.

original: I like the peace and quiet...no one to bother me...
pt: Eu gosto da paz e tranquilidade... ninguém me incomoda...
back: I like peace and quiet... no one bothers me...

original: N-not that you're being a bother! You're a most welcome guest.
pt: Não que você esteja sendo um incômodo! Você é um convidado muito bem-vindo.
back: - Not that you're being a bother! You're a very welcome guest.

original: You're the first guest I've ever had.
pt: Você é o primeiro convidado que eu já tive.
back: You're the first guest I've ever had.

original: Really? How long have you lived out here?
pt: Há quanto tempo você vive aqui?
back: - How long have you lived here?

original: A while...
pt: Um tempo...
back: - A while.

- I don't know. - No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

original: Uh-um....While you're here, Maple— I can get you something to eat, and then maybe I can brew you a potion...
pt: Enquanto você está aqui, Maple... posso lhe dar algo para comer, e então talvez eu possa fazer uma poção para você...
back: While you're here, Maple... I can give you something to eat, and then maybe I can make you a potion...

original: A...potion?
pt: Uma...poção?
back: - A... potion?

original: Y-yeah! Since I'm a witch.
pt: Desde que sou uma bruxa.
back: - Since I'm a witch.

original: Is that ok with you? That I'm a witch.
pt: Está tudo bem para você?
back: - Is everything okay with you?

original: Uh...You're not a very scary witch.
pt: Você não é uma bruxa assustadora.
back: - You're not a scary witch.

original: The witches I've read about in stories all are powerful, and eat people...
pt: As bruxas que li em histórias são todas poderosas, e comem pessoas...
back: The witches I read in stories are all powerful, and they eat people...

original: I could be scarier if you'd like me to be! I'm actually very powerful.
pt: Eu poderia ser mais assustador se você gostaria que eu fosse! Eu sou na verdade muito poderoso.
back: I could be scarier if you'd like me to be! I'm actually very powerful.

original: A-and if you ever find someone you don't like, I could--
pt: E se você encontrar alguém que você não gostar, eu poderia...
back: And if you find someone you don't like, I could...

original: No, it's fine, really.
pt: Não, está tudo bem, a sério.
back: - No, it's okay, really.

original: (I hope this snowstorm passes soon...)
pt: (Eu espero que esta tempestade de neve passe em breve...)
back: (I hope this snowstorm passes soon...)

original: Let me start working on dinner.
pt: Permita-me começar a trabalhar no jantar.
back: Allow me to start working for dinner.

original: I'm not sure if I'm hungry. The shelter alone is enough, thank you.
pt: Não sei se estou com fome, só o abrigo é suficiente, obrigado.
back: - I don't know if I'm hungry, only the shelter is enough, thank you.

original: I'll be gone as soon as the snow passes. I'd feel bad to impose.
pt: Estarei fora assim que a neve passar.
back: I'll be out as soon as the snow passes.

original: O-oh...
pt: O-oh...

original: Well, the snowstorm's going to last until tomorrow.
pt: Bem, a tempestade de neve vai durar até amanhã.
back: Well, the snowstorm will last until tomorrow.

original: The couch really is comfy, and I have some spare blankets I can get you.
pt: O sofá está confortável, e eu tenho alguns cobertores sobressalentes que eu posso conseguir para você.
back: The sofa is comfortable, and I have some spare blankets that I can get for you.

original: And let me cook you dinner! You must be starving.
pt: E deixe-me cozinhar o jantar!
back: - And let me cook dinner!

original: You really don't have to- I'm not hungr-
pt: Você realmente não tem que... eu não estou com fome...
back: You really don't have to... I'm not hungry...

original: B-but I would be a bad host if I didn't feed you!
pt: Mas eu seria um mau anfitrião se não te alimentasse!
back: But I would be a bad host if I didn't feed you!

original: (I don't think shes gonna take no for an answer)
pt: (Eu não acho que ela vai aceitar um não como resposta)
back: (I don't think she'll accept a no as an answer)

original: Ok. I'm going to make food so I'm not a bad host, and you can eat it if you get hungry.
pt: Vou fazer comida por isso não sou um mau anfitrião, e você pode comê-la se você ficar com fome.
back: I'm gonna make food so I'm not a bad host, and you can eat it if you get hungry.

original: (Is this really a witch's house?)
pt: (Esta é realmente a casa de uma bruxa?)
back: (Is this really a witch's house?)

original: (I hope the food isn't poisoned.)
pt: (Eu espero que a comida não seja envenenada.)
back: - (I hope the food isn't poisoned.)

original: Well, the lure spell worked, but I feel like I've already messed up the rest.
pt: Bem, o feitiço de isca funcionou, mas sinto que já estraguei o resto.
back: Well, the bait spell worked, but I feel like I've ruined the rest.

original: This is so difficult!
pt: Isto é tão difícil!
back: - This is so hard!

original: I don't think you're supposed to make friends with soup ingredients...
pt: Não acho que você deve fazer amigos com ingredientes de sopa...
back: - I don't think you should make friends with soup ingredients...

original: I guess the soup's still edible. Maybe I don't need human in here like the recipe says. Toad and mushroom alone add plenty flavor...
pt: Acho que a sopa ainda é comestível. Talvez eu não precise de humanos aqui como a receita diz. Sapo e cogumelos sozinhos adicionar sabor abundante...
back: - I think the soup is still edible. Maybe I don't need humans here as the recipe says. Toad and mushrooms alone add abundant flavor...

original: Maybe I could just have a friend instead...yeah...that'd be nice.
pt: Talvez eu pudesse ter um amigo em vez disso... sim... isso seria bom.
back: - Maybe I could have a friend instead... yeah... that'd be good.

original: A whole new world of possibility— A friend!
pt: Um novo mundo de possibilidades... Um amigo!
back: A new world of possibilities... a friend!

original: I'm gonna have a friend... One whole friend! That's so many!
pt: Vou ter um amigo... um amigo inteiro!
back: I'll have a friend... an entire friend!

original: Now then...dinner. What should I make for dinner...
pt: Agora então... jantar, o que devo fazer para o jantar?
back: Now then... dinner, what should I do for dinner?

original: I probably shouldn't offer her the soup I was considering putting her in...
pt: Provavelmente não devia oferecer-lhe a sopa que estava considerando colocá-la em...
back: - I probably shouldn't offer you the soup I was considering putting you in...

- I don't know. - No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

original: I-I don't remember what humans eat.
pt: Não lembro o que os humanos comem.
back: I don't remember what humans eat.

original: Uh...maybe it says something in one of the books I have lying around...
pt: Talvez diga algo em um dos livros que tenho por aí...
back: - Maybe say something in one of the books I have out there...

original: Well, the door isn't locked, and the window doesn't look too difficult to open.
pt: A porta não está trancada e a janela não parece difícil de abrir.
back: The door isn't locked and the window doesn't seem hard to open.

original: It's still snowing pretty heavily... I guess I'm staying put for the time being.
pt: Ainda está nevando bastante... acho que vou ficar aqui por enquanto.
back: It's still snowing a lot... I think I'll stay here for now.

original: Ahhh...what is that delicious smell?
pt: Que cheiro delicioso é esse?
back: - What's that delicious smell?

original: All finished! I made fruit pie and cookies, and they're completely SAFE and GOOD to eat!
pt: Eu fiz torta de frutas e biscoitos, e eles são completamente seguros e bons para comer!
back: I made fruit pie and cookies, and they are completely safe and good to eat!

original: That all looks and smells really tasty...and I haven't eaten since this morning...
pt: Isso tudo parece e cheira realmente saboroso ... e eu não tenho comido desde esta manhã ...
back: It all looks and smells really tasty... and I haven't eaten since this morning...

original: (...If I die, I die.)
pt: Se eu morrer, eu morrerei.
back: If I die, I will die.

original: Oh wow...this is really good!
pt: Isso é realmente bom!
back: - That's really good!

original: T-thank you. And now for the potion...
pt: Obrigado, e agora pela poção...
back: - Thank you, and now for the potion...

original: Uhh, actually— that pie made me super sleepy! I think I need to call it a night, sorry.
pt: Na verdade, aquela torta me deixou super sonolenta!
back: Actually, that pie made me super sleepy!

original: Ah... Ok.
pt: Está bem.
back: - Okay.

original: I h-hope you aren't eaten in your s-sleep...
pt: Espero que você não seja comido em seu sono...
back: - I hope you're not eaten in your sleep...

original: T-thanks.
pt: Obrigado.
back: - Thank you.

original: (Maybe it'd be dangerous to fall asleep here... If she really is a witch.)
pt: (Talvez seria perigoso adormecer aqui... se ela realmente fosse uma bruxa.)
back: (Perhaps it would be dangerous to fall asleep here... if she were really a witch.)

original: Well, I woke up. That's a good sign.
pt: Bem, acordei, isso é um bom sinal.
back: Well, I woke up, that's a good sign.

original: Got all my organs... I feel pretty good, actually.
pt: Tenho todos os meus órgãos... eu me sinto muito bem, na verdade.
back: I've got all my organs... I feel really good, actually.

original: Shirley's been really nice, hosting out of nowhere like that.
pt: A Shirley tem sido muito simpática, hospedando do nada assim.
back: - Shirley's been very nice, staying out of nowhere like this.

original: She seemed kinda bummed about the potion thing. Maybe it'd be ok to try?
pt: Ela parecia um pouco chateada com a coisa da poção.
back: - She seemed a little upset about the potion thing.

original: Maybe having a witch as a friend could be beneficial... Though I can't think of anyone I dislike enough to have eaten.
pt: Talvez ter uma bruxa como amiga possa ser benéfico... embora eu não possa pensar em ninguém que eu não goste o suficiente para ter comido.
back: Maybe having a witch as a friend can be beneficial... although I can't think of anyone I don't like enough to have eaten.

original: Maybe I could get superpowers from her potions. I've always wanted to see what it was like to be invisible, or maybe fly.
pt: Talvez eu pudesse obter superpoderes de suas poções. Sempre quis ver como era ser invisível, ou talvez voar.
back: Maybe I could get superpowers from your potions. I always wanted to see what it was like to be invisible, or maybe fly.

original: Good Morning! W-would you like breakfast? There's still some pie left, if you'd like that...
pt: Bom dia! Você gostaria de tomar o café da manhã? Ainda sobrou uma torta, se você quiser isso...
back: - Good morning, would you like to have breakfast?

original: Actually, Is it still possible to have that potion? You seemed like you really wanted me to have it.
pt: Na verdade, ainda é possível ter essa poção? Você parecia que realmente queria que eu a tivesse.
back: - Actually, it's still possible to have this potion?

original: Though I have a few questions about it first.
pt: Embora eu tenha algumas perguntas sobre isso primeiro.
back: Although I have some questions about it first.

original: That smell...is that...hot cocoa?
pt: Esse cheiro... é...cacau quente?
back: - Is that smell... hot cocoa?

original: Y-yes! I figured the best potion would be one humans can make too.
pt: Achei que a melhor poção seria uma pessoa humana também pode fazer.
back: - I thought the best potion would be a human person can do too.

original: I hope that's ok. I'm a little low on supplies right now, but I can make other things too.
pt: Espero que esteja tudo bem, estou um pouco sem suprimentos agora, mas posso fazer outras coisas também.
back: - I hope it's okay, I'm a little out of supplies now, but I can do other things too.

original: But I wanted...to brew a friendship potion...since you're my first f-friend...
pt: Mas eu queria... fazer uma poção de amizade... já que você é meu primeiro amigo...
back: But I wanted to... make a potion of friendship... since you're my first friend...

original: Ahh, that's really sweet...
pt: Ahh, isso é realmente doce...
back: - Ahh, that's really sweet...

original: I shouldn't have doubted you. You've been nothing but nice, I really shouldn't have been worried about you eating me or something.
pt: Você não tem sido nada além de simpático, eu realmente não deveria estar preocupado com você me comendo ou algo assim.
back: You've been nothing but nice, I really shouldn't be worried about you eating me or something.

original: Well, I did think about it, but I decided a friend is more valuable.
pt: Bem, eu pensei nisso, mas eu decidi que um amigo é mais valioso.
back: Well, I thought about it, but I decided a friend is more valuable.

original: R-really?
pt: A sério?
back: - Really?

original: N-not for long! Just a passing thought, I swear!
pt: Não por muito tempo, só um pensamento passageiro, eu juro!
back: - Not for long, just a passing thought, I swear!

original: I was NOT planning to put you in ANY soup.
pt: Eu não estava planejando colocá-lo em qualquer sopa.
back: I wasn't planning on putting it in any soup.

original: Uh...then t-thanks, I guess.
pt: Então obrigado, eu acho.
back: - So thank you, I guess.

original: ...This isn't MAGIC hot cocoa, is it?
pt: ...Isto não é cacau quente MAGIC, não é?
back: This isn't MAGIC hot cocoa, is it?

original: No, just regular human variety.
pt: Não, apenas variedade humana normal.
back: - No, just normal human variety.

original: I'm not gonna get any cool powers from it?
pt: Não vou obter nenhum poder legal com isso?
back: - Won't I get any legal power with that?

original: N-no.
pt: Não.
back: - No, no, no.
- (Awww...)

original: Oh! Looks like the snowstorm has stopped too.
pt: Parece que a tempestade de neve também parou.
back: It seems that the snowstorm has also stopped.

original: Yeah, I figured enough's enough.
pt: Sim, imaginei que bastasse.
back: - Yeah, I figured that'd be enough.

original: ...Huh?
pt: ...Huh?

original: N-Nothing!
pt: Nada!
back: - Nothing!

original: ...Well, I should probably get going. Thank you for letting me stay.
pt: Obrigado por me deixarem ficar.
back: - Thank you for letting me stay.

original: No problem! I-if you'd ever like to come back, you're always welcome.
pt: Se você quiser voltar, você é sempre bem-vinda.
back: If you want to come back, you're always welcome.

original: I will, thank you.
pt: Eu vou, obrigado.
back: - I will, thank you.

original: ...Well, I should probably get going. Thank you for letting me stay.
pt: Obrigado por me deixarem ficar.
back: - Thank you for letting me stay.

original: No problem! I-if you'd ever like to come back, you're always welcome.
pt: Se você quiser voltar, você é sempre bem-vinda.
back: If you want to come back, you're always welcome.

original: I think I will, thank you.
pt: Acho que vou, obrigado.
back: - I think I will, thank you.

original: T-that went so well! I can't believe it!
pt: Isso correu tão bem!
back: - That went so well!

original: I need to practice human style cooking more for when she comes back!
pt: Preciso praticar o estilo humano cozinhando mais para quando ela voltar!
back: I need to practice the human style by cooking more for when she comes back!

original: Or maybe there'll be more people! I-I could have multiple friends!
pt: Ou talvez haja mais pessoas!
back: - Or maybe there's more people!

original: I hope they like frog and mushroom soup in the meantime...
pt: Espero que gostem de sapo e sopa de cogumelos enquanto isso...
back: - I hope you like toad and mushroom soup in the meantime...
